H0.text: Increases the need for trees is why recycling newspapers is good for the environment.

H1.text: Helps conserve resources is why recycling newspapers is good for the environment.

H2.text: Increasing the need for landfills is a reason that recycling newspapers is good for the environment because it reduces the amount of paper that must be produced.

H3.text: Helps remove pollutants from the air is the reason recycling newspapers is good for the environment.

A4.text: Recycling saves waste paper from occupying the homes of people and producing methane as it breaks down.

A5.text: Recycling causes 35% less water pollution and 74% less air pollution than making virgin paper.

A10.text: trees produce paper, which can be recycled into low-energy production cellulose (fiberised paper) insulation, then used as an energy-saving device in the ceiling of a home for 40 years, saving 2,000 times the fossil-fuel energy used in its production.
